findings.title: Library initialization function lacks access control
findings.description: The initWallet() function can be called by anyone on the library contract directly. The 'initialized' check only works in delegatecall context - when called on the library itself, initialized is false.
findings.impact: Anyone can become owner of the library contract, then call kill() to destroy it, bricking all dependent wallets.
findings.recommendation: Disable initializers on implementation contracts. Use OZ's _disableInitializers() in constructor.

findings.title: selfdestruct on shared library is catastrophic
findings.description: The kill() function uses selfdestruct on a shared library contract. If executed, all wallets using this library via delegatecall become non-functional.
findings.recommendation: Remove selfdestruct from shared libraries. Use upgradeable patterns with proper access control instead.
